column4: Question for the group.  I'm running Ubuntu 11.04 on a Toshiba Satellite Pro 200.  I got the thing fixed and the tech guy, for reasons unknown to me, did a hard block on the wireless network card.  I.e. rfkill list shows a hard block on wlan0.  How do I unblock this?  It seems that FN+F8 doesn't work.
Also does anyone know if the fnfx software is still relevant? The last update seems to be from 2004.
I found reference to it on one of the Ubuntu forums.  Supposedly it enables the FN keys to work under Ubuntu
